001package org.consensusj.bitcoinj.util;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.core.Block;
004import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
005import org.bitcoinj.base.internal.ByteUtils;
006
007import java.math.BigInteger;
008import java.util.Arrays;
009
010/**
011 * Utility class containing {@link #blockHeightFromCoinbase(Block)}
012 */
013public class BlockUtil {
014
015    /**
016     * Return the block height contained in a standalone BIP34-compatible
017     * Bitcoin block (or -1 if it's a pre-BIP34 block)
018     *
019     * @param block A Bitcoin block (need not be attached to a chain)
020     * @return The block height if available (BIP 34) or -1.
021     */
022    public static int blockHeightFromCoinbase(Block block) {
023        if (!block.isBIP34()) {
024            // Must be BIP34-compatible (block  227,836 or higher)
025            return Block.BLOCK_HEIGHT_UNKNOWN;
026        }
027        Transaction coinbase = block.getTransactions().get(0);
028        byte[] scriptBytes = coinbase.getInput(0).getScriptBytes();
029        // There appears to be a bug in bitcoinj 0.15.8 for recent blocks where the input[0] script of the coinbase tx can't be parsed
030        // The below code works for block 324140 but seems to fail on SegWit blocks, due to https://github.com/bitcoinj/bitcoinj/issues/1595
031//        Script script = new Script(scriptBytes);
032//        ScriptChunk chunk = script.getChunks().get(0);
033//        BigInteger height = new BigInteger(Utils.reverseBytes(chunk.data));
034        // Workaround: We'll parse just the bytes we need
035        BigInteger height;
036        if (scriptBytes[0] == 3) {
037            byte[] blockNumBytes = Arrays.copyOfRange(scriptBytes, 1, 4);
038            height = new BigInteger(ByteUtils.reverseBytes(blockNumBytes));
039        } else {
040            height = BigInteger.valueOf(-1);
041        }
042        return height.intValueExact();
043    }
044}
